definition: sale price/negotiated price/price reached in an auction
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]

sentences.english: The ratio of commissions to be collected shall be set in accordance with the principle of making an inverse ratio to the auction completion price.
sentences.chinese: 收取佣金的比例按照同拍賣成交價成反比的原則確定。

sentences.english: For some artists, the winning bids set new records.
sentences.chinese: 對一些藝術家來說，成交價刷新了紀錄。

sentences.english: Difference of cationic silk market improved, sold steadily increasing.
sentences.chinese: 差別化的陽離子絲市場行情好轉，成交價穩中有升。

sentences.english: The tax should be measured by the property's concluding price when the transaction is actually concluded.
sentences.chinese: 房產稅應該按房屋買賣時的實際成交價計徵。

sentences.english: The hammer price of the car broke the previous record.
sentences.chinese: 這款名車的拍賣成交價打破了此前的歷史記錄。

sentences.english: The proportion of commission to be charged shall be determined according to the principle that it is in inverse proportion to the transaction price.
sentences.chinese: 收取佣金的比例按照同拍賣成交價成反比的原則確定。

sentences.english: However, the price shall not be less than the reserve price.
sentences.chinese: 但成交價不得低於保留價。

sentences.english: Still, the final price was beyond all expectations.
sentences.chinese: 然而，最終的成交價還是超出了所有人的預期。

sentences.english: The tax should be measured by the property's price when the transaction is actually concluded.
sentences.chinese: 房產稅應該按房屋買賣時的實際成交價計徵。

definition: to auction/auction sale/to sell at a reduced price
to value/to appraise/to be valued at/estimate/valuation
Gundam, Japanese animation franchise/Jean-Luc Godard (1930-), French-Swiss film director
to quote a price/seller's first offer
